page.title: 06LITTLE BADDOW CHICKEN FARM
page.content: Spring Elms chicken farm is just outside Little Baddow.It is a small factory farm occupying 4 acres of land.It is owned and run by the Lambert family.The farm does not produce eggs but buys its chicks at one day old.The chicks are put into specially heated sheds and are kept with those of the same age.There are about 20000 chickens in the farm at any one time.When the chickens reach 6 weeks old they are killed by elecricution.They are then plucked frozen and packed in boxes of 12 and sold to local shops and eating places.The farm has its own vehicles which are fuelled from its own petrol pump.In this type of farming not only is the family employed but also specialised workers are used for killing and packing and one YTS person has been taken on.
